Description: Rim, body and handle sherd (mended from four fragments) of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: reserved band at top of lip, glazed black below; wall reserved with single black band preserved; top of lip glazed; exterior: lip and handle zone reserved with band between; glazed below; dilute bands on lipglazed black on handle and around handle root; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type A2 (possibly)
Curator's comments: Although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this sherd, the high rim and decoration find parallels with his South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 5C. These cups are both the earliest South Ionian cups at Naukratis and are relatively rare at the site. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18), Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116) and Vallet and Villard's Ionian Cup Type A2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). The number in Petrie's catalogue,119, is written in ink on the exterior surface of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 119)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 651, no. 81)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.079) (Phase 3)
